availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Lewis Nugent (Washington County, Mississippi, attorney, commissioner, lieutenant colonel, second lieutenant, captain, and assistant adjutant general (C.S.A.))

body.p: Washington County, Mississippi, attorney and soldier. Louisiana native. Married to Eleanor "Nellie" Smith Nugent in Washington County, Mississippi, on November 6, 1860. Student in East Feliciana Parish, Louisiana, in 1850. Graduate of Centenary College of Louisiana in Shreveport. Attorney in Washington County, Mississippi, in 1861. Commissioner of Deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Washington County in 1861. Served in the 28th Mississippi Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel and second lieutenant from 1861 to August 15, 1863. Served in Ferguson's Brigade (C.S.A.) as captain and assistant adjutant general from August 15, 1863, to February 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
